answers.answer: Hello,Sleep apnea increases the chances of diabetes,stroke ,TIA and peripheral nerve damage.All of these can cause tingling, pain, or numbness in the hands and feet and other body parts.Weight gain and obesity are also common effects of sleep apnea.But other possibilities for your symptoms are multiple sclerosis and underactive  thyroid,abnormal levels of calcium, potassium, or sodium in your body and a lack of vitamin B12, motor neurone disease, or autoimmune disorders like multiple sclerosis or lupus erythematosus. A diagnostic evaluation by a doctor is necessary to rule these out.Hope it helps .Take care and pls do keep us posted in case you have any additional queries.Kind regards.

question: I've always had numbness in my arms after waking or during the night waking me up, I started taking a B12 supplement referred by my doctor and that helped.  I've recently have gained some weight and am now 65 pounds over weight and have developed symptoms of sleep apnea and the numbness has returned could the two be related.
title: arm numbness and sleep apnea
